title: Daily Market Digest: February 20, 2026
subtitle: Mixed Sentiment as Indices Drift, Geopolitical Tensions Persist, and Key Economic Data Awaited

items.headline: U.S. Futures Climb Ahead of Inflation Data; Global Markets Show Mixed Performance Amid Geopolitical Concerns
items.summary: U.S. stock futures advanced early Friday as investors anticipated key Personal Consumption Expenditures (PCE) index data. This follows a downturn in major U.S. indices on Thursday, driven by ongoing geopolitical tensions between the United States and Iran, alongside concerns in the private credit market. Meanwhile, Indian equities experienced a rebound, and European markets opened higher, indicating a divergence in global sentiment.

items.statContext: S&P 500 futures +0.24%, Nasdaq 100 futures +0.35%, Dow futures +0.16% at 5:29 a.m. EST.

items.headline: Opendoor Technologies
items.summary: Shares surged after Q4 revenue and adjusted EBITDA exceeded expectations, with the company highlighting progress in its turnaround strategy.

items.headline: Deere & Co.
items.summary: The agricultural equipment manufacturer's stock jumped following strong first-quarter fiscal 2026 adjusted earnings results.

items.headline: Etsy Inc.
items.summary: The e-commerce platform saw its shares climb after reporting adjusted earnings of $0.92 per share for Q4 2025, surpassing analyst estimates.

items.headline: EPAM Systems
items.summary: The IT services company's stock slumped after issuing cautious guidance.

items.headline: Carvana
items.summary: Shares declined as the online used car retailer missed analyst estimates in its latest earnings report.

items.headline: Evergy Inc.
items.summary: The utility company's stock fell after its Q4 2025 adjusted earnings of $0.42 per share missed consensus estimates.

items.headline: Energy and Technology Lead U.S. Sectors; Utilities and Real Estate Lag
items.summary: On Friday, the Energy Select Sector SPDR ($XLE) saw a 1.9% rise, while the Technology Select Sector SPDR ($XLK) gained 1%. Conversely, the Utilities Select Sector SPDR ($XLU) fell 1.7%, and the Real Estate Select Sector SPDR ($XLRE) was down 1.3%. This indicates a mixed performance with some cyclical sectors showing strength.

items.headline: Rotation from Tech to 'Tangible' Sectors Continues Broadly
items.summary: A broader trend of rotation from technology to more 'tangible' sectors like Industrials, Energy, and Materials has been observed year-to-date, with these sectors leading the pack. However, daily movements can show temporary divergence, as seen with Technology's gain today. Consumer Staples are also experiencing a strong rally, potentially indicating a defensive shift in the market.

items.headline: U.S. Jobless Claims Fall, Trade Deficit Widens; Key Inflation and GDP Data Pending
items.summary: Initial jobless claims for the week ended February 14 decreased by 23,000 to 206,000, outperforming estimates. However, continuing claims rose by 17,000 to 1.869 million for the week ended February 7. The U.S. trade deficit expanded to $70.3 billion in December, exceeding expectations. Markets are now awaiting the release of the fourth-quarter GDP advance estimate and December PCE inflation data later today.

items.headline: U.S.-Iran Tensions Continue to Fuel Market Uncertainty and Oil Price Surge
items.summary: Heightened geopolitical tensions between the United States and Iran remain a significant factor influencing global markets. Concerns over a potential escalation are contributing to a substantial rise in oil prices, with crude oil futures tracking for a weekly gain of over 5%.

items.headline: Eurozone and UK Business Activity Accelerates in February
items.summary: Business activity in the eurozone accelerated in February, with the HCOB Flash Eurozone Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) rising to 51.9, indicating growth. Similarly, both the services and manufacturing sectors in the UK showed stronger-than-expected growth in February, with the flash UK composite output index reaching a 22-month high of 53.9 points.
